subject: Re: [junit] Re: Any plans to revamp junit?
msgSnippet: ... Agreed. As long as the tools find the correct static import for me, I think this is a win. If I have to do bookkeeping to find the static imports, though,
messageBody:
Sven Gorts wrote:

> --- Ilja Preuss <preuss@...> wrote:
> >
> > > -- make Assert no longer a superclass of TestCase.
> > to use Assert's
> > > methods unqualified, use static import
> >
> > Again, what's the value?
>
> Having the freedom to select only the assertions you
> need seems like a usefull feature to me. Perhaps I'm
> being a bit puristic but in a way the interface of
> TestCase seems polluted by all the assertions methods.

Agreed. As long as the tools find the correct static import for me, I
think this is a win. If I have to do bookkeeping to find the static
imports, though, it's a loss.

I think the current design smells the same way that using an interface
to "inherit" constants smells.
--
J. B. Rainsberger,
Diaspar Software Services
http://www.diasparsoftware.com :: +1 416 791-8603
Let's write software that people understand
